treated (and oppressed)? Men, women, and children, whose cry is: ‘Our Lord! Rescue
us from this town, whose people are oppressors; and raise for us from thee one who will
protect; and raise for us from thee one who will help!
Label: Recruitment

Source: Neelamar et.al "A Critical Analysis of the Jihadi Discourse through Online Magazines with Special Reference to ‘Wyeth’ Magazine"

Text: I am doing this martyrdom operation for the sake of Allah. I advise you to migrate to Somalia and wage war against your enemies. Death in honor is better than life in humiliation…To the Somalis living abroad, are you happy in your comfort while your religion, your people are being attacked and humiliated?
Label: Recruitment

Source: Lakomy et.al "Recruitment and Incitement to Violence in the Islamic State’s Online Propaganda: Comparative Analysis of Dabiq and Rumiyah"
Text: Therefore, rush O Muslims to your state. Yes, it is your state. Rush, because Syria isnot for the Syrians, and Iraq is not for the Iraqis. [...] The state is a state for all Muslims. [...] O Muslims everywhere, whoever is capable of performing hijrah  to the Islamic State, then let him do so, because hijrah to the land of Islam is obligatory
Label: Recruitment

Source: Lakomy et.al "Recruitment and Incitement to Violence in the Islamic State’s Online Propaganda: Comparative Analysis of Dabiq and Rumiyah"
Text: So if the schemesof the tawaghit have prevented you from performing hijrah to Iraq and Sham, thenknow that the doors of hijrah will remain open until the Hour is established. So who-ever is unable to perform hijrah to Iraq and Sham, then he should perform hijrah toLibya, Khurasan, Yemen, Sinai, West Africa, or any of the other wilayat and outposts ofthe Khilafah in the East and the West
Label: Recruitment

Source: Lakomy et.al "Recruitment and Incitement to Violence in the Islamic State’s Online Propaganda: Comparative Analysis of Dabiq and Rumiyah"

Text:
Hijrah has a comprehensive meaning as understood in Islam.
It is not simply just the act of moving from one place to
another; from a non-Muslim country to a Muslim country. Ibn
al-Qayyim explains that it is, in fact, an emigration of the
body and the spirit.
